slides.title: Testing expressions
slides.description: Quick tour how to check variables in a chart

slides.title: Condition
slides.description:
this tour will run perfect, if
  • Projects are activ(see project tour)
  • IDE is connected to a board

slides.title: Set timing
slides.description: Select how often you want data to be updated

slides.title: Open testing window
slides.description: ...click on &lt/&gt left to bottom of terminal window.

slides.title: Set Name
slides.description: First assign a name, that you will see in chart

slides.title: Set Espression
slides.description: Next assign an expression, you would like to observe

slides.title: Select type of variable
slides.description:
Last select type of expression.
  • Number will shown as line in the chart
  • Text will show a point on each change, data on mouseOver

slides.title: Add to expression list
slides.description: Click on this button, if you want to add new expression.

slides.title: Remove old expressions
slides.description: Remove expression that you don't need anymore. Simply click on - button to remove from list

slides.title: run fetching expressions
slides.description: click on run button to start testing. Refresh is 1/sec, so wait some secondes to see.

slides.title: Stop fetching expressions
slides.description: click on stop button to stop refreshin chart testing.

slides.title: Clear Chart
slides.description: click on Reset button to clear chart

slides.title: Switch back to terminal
slides.description: Switch back to terminal mode. You can switch between both whenever you want.

slides.title: Testing done
slides.description: ...Now that you got a first overview, check the functions by yourself and enjoy.
